case_title: SHER KHAN vs RAWALPINDI ELECTRIC & POWER Co. LTD.

accussed_details.name: Sher Khan
allegation: Theft of materials from Power Workshop

defense: Iftikhar Ahmad Abbasi (initially refused to appear)

complaint_summary: Sher Khan was accused of stealing materials from the Power Workshop and selling them to a party across the Railway Line, Chamanzar Colony. He was charge-sheeted and terminated from service effective 24-07-76.
investigation_summary: An inquiry committee was formed on 14-02-76 to investigate the theft case. Sher Khan was issued a charge-sheet on 19-03-76 and required to submit an explanation. Multiple inquiries were held, but Sher Khan was not properly informed of changes in inquiry dates. The inquiry report lacked sufficient evidence to prove theft. The initial inquiry committee included Allah Bux Awan, Shafiq Ahmad, Fazal Dad, and Ijaz Ahmad. It was later reconstituted to include the Commercial Officer, Administrative Officer, and Union Representative Maqbool Ahmad.

findings: Failure to notify Sher Khan of inquiry date change
judgment_summary.directive: Sher Khan reinstated with full back benefits
judgment_summary.management_rights: Liberty to conduct proper inquiry if desired

Decision_or_verdict: Termination of Sher Khan's services declared illegal; reinstatement ordered.
legal_arguments: Violation of Section 6 of the Pakistan Essential Services (Maintenance) Act, 1952.
Improper inquiry procedures and lack of evidence.

witness_statement.Jahangir Khan: Confirmed his previous statement but did not provide evidence proving theft.
witness_statement.Unnamed lady witness: Statement confirmed by other witnesses but lacked direct evidence against Sher Khan.

maxims.Audi alteram partem: Sher Khan was not properly informed of inquiry changes, violating his right to be heard.

legal_terms.Charge-sheet: A formal document accusing an individual of misconduct.
legal_terms.Ex parte: Decision made in absence of the accused.

words_and_phrases.Essential service: A service deemed critical for public welfare and subject to special regulations.

summary_vector_notes: Sher Khan's termination was declared illegal due to procedural lapses in inquiry and lack of evidence. The court ordered reinstatement with full back benefits, allowing the employer to conduct a proper inquiry if desired.

key_issues_details.allegations: Theft of articles from the establishment
key_issues_details.legal_basis: Section 6 of the Pakistan Essential Services (Maintenance) Act, 1952
key_issues_details.respondent_claim: Proper inquiry held and appellant found guilty
